member.summary: This method is used to enable and cofigure OCR decoding options.
member.param: Determines which OCR fonts are used for decoding.

A string that represents one or more template patterns for the OCR decode. A string that represents a list of characters that can be substituted for the lower case 'h' in the template strings.
A null-terminated string that represents a check character position in the template strings.

member.name: M:Honeywell.DataCollection.Decoding.DecodeBase.SetupDecodeCenteringWindow(Honeywell.DataCollection.Decoding.SetupType,System.Boolean@,Honeywell.DataCollection.Decoding.Rect)
member.summary: This method provides for enabling and configuration of "decode centering mode" during the scanning. In this mode the call to a scan or decode method is only successful if the area bounding the decoded symbol intersects the rectangle bondries defined by this method.
member.remarks: This method allows the engine to discriminate between symbols that are located physically close to each other so only one symbol is captured during decode. Only the symbol intersecting the defined rectangle is returned.
member.param: Determines if using current or default settings.
Determines whether centering is enabled or disabled.

member.name: T:Honeywell.DataCollection.Decoding.ExposureSettings
member.summary: Enumeration of exposure setting parameters that may be modified or retrieved by the SetExposureSettings and GetExposureSettings methods.

member.name: F:Honeywell.DataCollection.Decoding.ExposureSettings.ES_EXPOSURE_METHOD
member.summary: The type of exposure method desired

member.name: F:Honeywell.DataCollection.Decoding.ExposureSettings.ES_TARGET_VALUE
member.summary: The auto exposure algorithm tries to get a given percentile of all of the pixel values of the image, to fall at a target value. This parameter specifies the desired target value. The default value for this parameter is 150, with a minimum of 1 and a maximum of 255.

member.name: F:Honeywell.DataCollection.Decoding.ExposureSettings.ES_TARGET_PERCENTILE
member.summary: The auto exposure algorithm tries to get a given percentile of all of the pixel values of the image, to fall at a certain value. This parameter sets where that percentile is in the image data. This value is configurable between 1 and 99, where 1 represents the darkest percentile of the image, and 99 represents the lightest percentile of the image.

member.name: F:Honeywell.DataCollection.Decoding.ExposureSettings.ES_TARGET_ACCEPT_GAP
member.summary: This specifies how far the pixel value of the TargetPercentile can stray from the TargetValue but still be considered an acceptable image. The default value for this parameter is 10, the minimum value is 1 and the maximum value is 50. It should be noted however that as this value gets smaller, the time to acquire a conforming image might be lengthened.

member.name: F:Honeywell.DataCollection.Decoding.ExposureSettings.ES_MAX_EXP
member.summary: This specifies the maximum exposure value to be used by the auto exposure logic during image acquisition. The default value for this parameter is 1312, the minimum value is 1 and the maximum value is 7874, in units of 127uS. It should be noted that this parameter would allow for the adjustment of the frame rate of the imager to achieve larger exposure times; therefore it will affect the speed at which the imager acquires an image.

member.name: F:Honeywell.DataCollection.Decoding.ExposureSettings.ES_MAX_GAIN
member.summary: This specifies the maximum gain value to be used by the auto exposure logic during image acquisition. The default value for this parameter is 1, the minimum value is 1 and the maximum value is 4.

member.name: F:Honeywell.DataCollection.Decoding.ExposureSettings.ES_FRAME_RATE
member.summary: This parameter defines the starting frame rate to be used by the auto exposure logic during image acquisition. The default value for this parameter is 30, the minimum value is 1 and the maximum value is 30.

member.name: F:Honeywell.DataCollection.Decoding.ExposureSettings.ES_CONFORM_IMAGE
member.summary: Where the auto exposure software is always trying to get the TargetPercentile of pixel data to fall at the TargetValue, this parameter tells the image acquisition software that the acquired image must conform to the defined imager settings, (target percentile, target value, number of updates). The default value for this parameter is 0 for false, indicating that every image regardless of whether or not the target percentile of pixel values falls within the acceptance gap of the target value.

member.name: F:Honeywell.DataCollection.Decoding.ExposureSettings.ES_CONFORM_TRIES
member.summary: This specifies the maximum number of attempts that the auto exposure logic can use while attempting to acquire an image that conforms to the target values set up for the auto exposure algorithm, before considering the image as conforming. This parameter is only valid when the ImageMustConform value is set to 1 or true. The default value for this parameter is 6, the minimum value is 1 and the maximum value is 8.

member.name: F:Honeywell.DataCollection.Decoding.ExposureSettings.ES_SPECULAR_EXCLUSION
member.summary: This parameter is no longer used by the image acquisition logic and should be set to 0.

member.name: F:Honeywell.DataCollection.Decoding.ExposureSettings.ES_SPECULAR_SAT
member.summary: This parameter is no longer used by the image acquisition logic and should be set to 0.

member.name: F:Honeywell.DataCollection.Decoding.ExposureSettings.ES_SPECULAR_LIMIT
member.summary: This parameter is no longer used by the image acquisition logic and should be set to 0.

member.name: F:Honeywell.DataCollection.Decoding.ExposureSettings.ES_FIXED_EXP
member.summary: This is the exposure setting when the exposure mode is fixed. The default value for this parameter is 255, the minimum value is 1 and the maximum value is 7874.

member.name: F:Honeywell.DataCollection.Decoding.ExposureSettings.ES_FIXED_GAIN
member.summary: This is the gain setting when the exposure mode is fixed. The default value f or this parameter is 1, the minimum value is 1 and the maximum value is 4.

member.name: F:Honeywell.DataCollection.Decoding.ExposureSettings.ES_FIXED_FRAME_RATE
member.summary: This is the frame rate setting when the exposure mode is fixed. The default value for this parameter is 30, the minimum value is 1 and the maximum value is 30.

member.name: T:Honeywell.DataCollection.Decoding.ImagerPropertiesStruct
member.summary: I created a imager properties struct for retrieving the imager properties for two reasons. First, it's easier to marshall the pointer to the strcuture and second we don't want to expose all of the imager properties so by exposing them to an app via the class we can hide what we don't want them to see but still have them available in the struct

member.summary: Get/Set the key to use for the scan Trigger.

member.name: P:Honeywell.DataCollection.WinCE.Decoding.DecodeControl.AutoScan
member.summary: Get/Set the AutoScan feature which allows for automatically initiating a barcode scan when the trigger key is pressed. If this property is set true, it captures the Trigger Key and dedicates it to the Decode Control until it is set false again.
member.remarks: The use of this property is limited to one Decode Control at a time. If any other application or form has already registered the Trigger Key, an exception will be generated at the time this property is set which may be when the control is instantiated (see the example code).

member.name: T:Honeywell.DataCollection.Decoding.ConfigType
member.summary: Enum that defines the type of SymbologyConfig object for a given symbology Symbologies that do not have a length parameter associated with them like UPC and EAN will of of type FLAGS_ONLY. Symbologies that have a length parameter like Code 39 or Aztec Code will be of type FLAGS_RANGE.

member.name: F:Honeywell.DataCollection.Decoding.ConfigType.FLAGS_ONLY
member.summary: Indicates the symbology config object does not have or support a length property.

member.name: F:Honeywell.DataCollection.Decoding.ConfigType.FLAGS_AND_LENGTH
member.summary: Indicates the symbology config object does have and supports min and max length property.

member.name: T:Honeywell.DataCollection.Decoding.SymbologyConfig
member.summary: Class used to configure symbologies that have both flags and a Minimum and Maximum length parameter associated with them. This class would be used to configure symbologies like Code 39, PDF417, Aztec Code etc.

member.name: M:Honeywell.DataCollection.Decoding.SymbologyConfig.#ctor(Honeywell.DataCollection.Decoding.SymID)
member.summary: Class used to configure symbologies.

member.name: M:Honeywell.DataCollection.Decoding.SymbologyConfig.ReadConfig(Honeywell.DataCollection.Decoding.SetupType)
member.summary: Read the symbologies decode properties from the scan engine. Only the properties specified by the mask property are updated.

member.name: M:Honeywell.DataCollection.Decoding.SymbologyConfig.WriteConfig
member.summary: Write the symbology decode properties to the scan engine. Only the properties specified by the mask are written. Min and Max length properties are ignored if the symbology config object is FLAGS_ONLY.

member.name: M:Honeywell.DataCollection.Decoding.SymbologyConfig.SetToDefaults
member.summary: Sets the symbology decode parameters to their default settings.

member.name: M:Honeywell.DataCollection.Decoding.SymbologyConfig.GetMinMaxRange(System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Returns the minimum and maximum allowable length value for the symbolgy.

member.name: P:Honeywell.DataCollection.Decoding.SymbologyConfig.mask
member.summary: Bit mask is used to indicate which properties: flags, minLength or maxLength should be written or read by the WriteConfig and ReadConfig methods.

member.name: P:Honeywell.DataCollection.Decoding.SymbologyConfig.symId
member.summary: Symbology Identifier

member.name: P:Honeywell.DataCollection.Decoding.SymbologyConfig.symConfigType
member.summary: Symbology configuration type identifier

member.name: P:Honeywell.DataCollection.Decoding.SymbologyConfig.flags
member.summary: The flags property is used to enable and disable various symbology options.

member.name: P:Honeywell.DataCollection.Decoding.SymbologyConfig.minLength
member.summary: Used to get or set the minmum allowable length of a symbology.

member.name: P:Honeywell.DataCollection.Decoding.SymbologyConfig.maxLength
member.summary: Used to get or set the maximum allowable length of a symbology.
